title: 112_s3362
content: The "Dam Safety Act of 2012" aims to reduce risks from dam failure in the US by reauthorizing a national dam safety program. This program combines expertise and resources from both Federal and non-Federal communities to achieve national dam safety hazard reduction. The National Dam Safety Program Act is amended to replace "Director" with "Administrator" throughout. Additionally, there are amendments related to the inspection of dams and the National Dam Safety Program. SEC. 5 amends the National Dam Safety Program Act to include a comprehensive dam safety hazard education program. SEC. 6 focuses on public awareness and outreach for dam safety. SEC. 6 amends the National Dam Safety Program Act to include a nationwide public awareness and outreach program for dam safety. The National Dam Safety Program Act is amended to increase annual funding to $9.2 million for fiscal years 2012 through 2016. The maximum amount of allocation is also adjusted for fiscal year 2013 and subsequent years. The National Dam Safety Program Act is amended to adjust funding allocation limits for fiscal year 2013 and beyond. The National dam inventory funding is set at $500,000 for each fiscal year from 2012 to 2016. Public awareness provisions are also revised. The National Dam Safety Program Act is amended to allocate $1,000,000 for public awareness and adjust funding for research and dam safety training for fiscal years 2012 through 2016. The National Dam Safety Program Act is amended to allocate $750,000 for staff and $1,000,000 for public awareness for fiscal years 2012 through 2016.
